title: 109_s3584
content: The Act titled "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training programs for supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, amending Section 4121 of title 5, United States Code to define the term 'supervisor' and establish operating standards for consultation with the Office of Personnel Management. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, including interactive instructor-based training on developing goals and objectives with employees and discussing progress relative to performance goals. The program includes training for supervisors on developing goals with employees, discussing progress, mentoring, managing unacceptable performance, and carrying out supervisor duties. Additionally, interactive instructor-based training on prohibited personnel practices is provided. The supervisor training program includes interactive instructor-based training on prohibited personnel practices and mentoring new supervisors in communication, critical thinking, responsibility, flexibility, motivating employees, and teamwork. The supervisor training program includes interactive training on communication, critical thinking, responsibility, flexibility, motivating employees, and teamwork. Supervisors must complete the program within 1 year of appointment and then every 3 years thereafter. The Office of Personnel Management shall establish a program for supervisor training that includes credit for previous training completed. Regulations must be prescribed within 180 days of the enactment of the Act to monitor agency compliance with the program. The Office of Personnel Management will establish a supervisor training program with credit for prior training. Regulations must be prescribed within 180 days to monitor agency compliance. Amendments take effect 180 days after enactment for new supervisors and employees in defined positions. Each individual employed as a supervisor must complete a training program within 3 years of the effective date of the section. Each supervisor must complete a training program within 3 years of the effective date of this section, and then every 3 years thereafter. Management competency standards are outlined in Section 3. The Office of Personnel Management shall issue guidance on management competency standards for supervisors, including definitions and expectations. Management may prescribe regulations for supervisors to effectively manage and be accountable for employee performance. Each agency must develop standards to assess supervisor performance, considering guidance from the Office of Personnel Management. Agencies must also assess supervisors' capacity to meet the OPM guidance. Each agency must assess supervisors' capacity to meet OPM guidance and develop a training program to address identified issues. Agencies are required to submit annual progress reports to OPM. The agency must provide progress reports to the Office on the implementation of the section. Technical amendments are made to the table of sections in the United States Code. Amendment made to management competency standards in regulations under title 5, United States Code. Reference to section 4305 changed to section 4306.
